EXAM: CT Head Without IV Contrast 70450

INDICATION:fall, found down   

TECHNIQUE: Helical CT of the head was obtained without intravenous contrast. Axial, coronal and sagittal images were created.

Dose reduction technique was used including one or more of the following: automated exposure control, adjustment of mA and kV according to patient size, and/or iterative reconstruction.

COMPARISON: None. 

FINDINGS:

Quality: Average.  No unusual artifacts beyond the limitations of routine CT.

INTRACRANIAL:
Hemorrhage: None.
Mass effect: None.
Brain parenchyma: Moderate generalized cerebral and cerebellar volume loss. Mild nonspecific periventricular hypoattenuation is most consistent with chronic small vessel ischemic disease.
Ventricles: Reflect volume loss.
Other: None.

CRANIAL/EXTRACRANIAL:
Bony structures: No depressed or displaced skull fractures.
Paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells: Sphenoid sinus mucosal thickening.
Visualized orbits: The imaged portions appear normal.
Other: Noncontributory.

IMPRESSION:

1.   No acute intracranial findings.

Reading Doctor: Rodriguez, Paul 
Visit No.: 3100617054
Order No.: RD0753055
Exam Date: 07/28/2019 00:00:00
Exam: 49406 - CT image guided fluid collection
================================================================================

1.  Completed CT-guided lower neck fluid aspiration.
TYPE OF STUDY:  CT IMAGE GUIDED FLUID COLLECTION INDICATION:  aspirate abscess DISCUSSION:  Informed consent was obtained. The patient has a lower posterior neck fluid collection. He has had recent cervical spine fusion surgery. CT was used to localize a fluid collection. The neck was prepped and draped in usual sterile fashion. 1% lidocaine was used for local anesthesia. A 20-gauge was advanced into the fluid collection near the tip of the spinous process. Imaging showed good position. Approximate 5 mL of light red fluid was aspirated. This was sent to the laboratory for analysis. Needle was removed. No complications occurred. [CT individualized dose optimization technique was used to include one or more of the following techniques: automated exposure control, mA and /or kV dose modulation according to patient size, and/or iterative reconstructive technique.] [MIP technique was done for 2D and/or 3D rendering.]

Electronically Signed By: Rodriguez, Paul
Signed Date: 07/28/2019 5:16 PM CDT)

Exam: 71045 - MMU Screen Tomo Bil w/CAD
================================================================================

Department: OPO
Reason For Exam: screening

MMU Screen Tomo Bil w/CAD

Bilateral screening mammograms with tomosynthesis and CAD imaging.

Comparison:    10/20/2015

Findings: There are scattered areas of fibroglandular density. No
suspicious masses, suspicious calcifications, areas of architectural
distortion or secondary signs of malignancy are seen.

Impression:
1. BI-RADS 2 (benign findings).
2. No evidence of malignancy is seen.
3. Note: A negative mammogram should not preclude further evaluation
of a clinically suspicious abnormality.
4. Recommend routine bilateral screening mammograms in one year.

Baxter Regional Medical Center generates a yearly reminder letter for
screening mammograms.
